column1: shoot of a length and in the corridor. Nips away after angling in and beats him on the outside edge as he wafts at it
back of a length in the corridor, tapped to point off the back foot

Abbot leaps to his left at deep square and stops a pull shot on the half-volley. Does well to stop the boundary after realising the prospects of a catch were fast dying. Short picked this indipper off his hips with a swivel
full outswinger outside off, looks to carve it behind point. Beaten
length on off stump, hangs back and whips it to deep square's right. Another nice piece of fielding, a slide saves two runs
back of a length and just outside off, pushed it past short cover off the back foot

guides it straight to cover point. A lazy chop away from the body. Didn't get on top of this short ball outside off, and didn't go hard at it either. Simple catch for the fielder who barely had to move
139kph, good length and swinging away from outside off, left alone
inswinger now, defended solidly in front of off stump
short ball in the corridor, gets on the back foot to try and bludgeon a pull on the rise. Beaten by pace
short and climbing up in the corridor, cuts and is beaten by bounce this time
length and in at off stump, uses the angle to dab it into the midwicket area
overpitched on leg stump, watches it closely and chips with freedom, aerially, through the vacant midwicket region
short ball, wide outside off. Looks to flat-bat it through the off side, gets it to mid-off off the toe end
oh yes, stunning from Wade! it's dropped short on an off stump line and he gets behind this very quickly. Pulls cleanly, right off the middle, to clear the square leg fence. 91 metres
yorker speared in at middle stump, jammed back down the pitch
another one! Gets under the short ball in the corridor and lifts it wide of deep square leg
full toss on middle stump, clipped between deep square and deep midwicket
good length and in at leg stump, tapped into the square leg area off the back foot. Oh he's got it off the thigh guard, in fact.
back of a length on leg stump, taps it into the leg side with soft hands
back of a length on the hips and he whips it neatly past the backward square leg fielder
slower ball, full on off stump. Doesn't pick this. Drags it out to mid-on as he looks to drive through the covers
full on off stump, gets the front leg out of the way and mistimes a drive. Straight to mid-off
length on leg stump, clipped on the up to short fine's right
gets the length ball to grip and turn away from off stump. Pushed to the off side on the front foot
drops it short on off stump, he gets deep in the crease and puts this pull shot away easily to the wide long-on fence
short outside off, sliced to short third man
full outside off, hammered with a drive, wide of long-off
back of a length outside off, gets on the back foot to try and whip one through midwicket. Gets an inside edge to short fine
back of a length and in at leg stump, pushed into the midwicket area from th crease
good length on middle stump, flicks the wrists to get this into the midwicket area
doesn't pick the slower ball but he he's swung hard enough for this to clear mid-on. Once more, looking to crash a drive through the covers and his bat ends up turning in his palms
he's picked this though! 107 metres! Another slower ball, floated in full on off stump. He backs away, picks it out of the hand and pummels it straight over the bowler's head
full toss on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket's left
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Chips it to long-on with a pull
back of a length outside off, gets behind the line and drives on the up to find cover point
back of a length, flat and drifting in sharply at off stump. Chopped straight to point
back of a length on middle stump, tucked to deep midwicket off the back foot
dropped! Dwarshuis keeps the moustache and drops the ball. At point. Simple, simple one. Short ball climbs at Wade who slices the cut with no power at all
back of a length at middle, punched to long-on
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
good length on middle stump, gets down and sweeps along the floor to deep square
good length and just outside off, punched on the up to long-off
back of a length in the corridor, pulls flat and on the bounce to deep square leg who pouches it and does the balancing act to manage the force and stay in
offcutter, back of a length outside off. Chopped straight to point
full on middle stump, squeezed out to long-on
nicely done. Slower ball, short and wide outside off. Waits for it, reaches out and stabs it between point and short third man
offcutter dropped short on middle stump, allows it to come on and steers it to the long leg boundary with a pull
short ball outside off, punched to long-off off the back foot
short ball, 102 kph, drifted in. But he's position quickly to slice this through point
length on off stump, pushed to long-on
good length, floated up at off stump. Tapped to extra cover on the up
full and fired in at leg stump. Flicked to deep midwicket
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
full toss outside off, punched to long-off
misfield at extra cover as he drill this overpitched ball outside off. It was off the toe-end but still had enough on it to pierce the fielding effort there
overpitched outside off, carved to long-off
slower ball, full outside off. Dragged out to long-on with a mistimed drive
another overpitched ball with width. This time he finds sweeper cover with the drive
yorker just outside off. Wade shuffles and cut out the room for himself. Digs it out
back of a length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
good length wide outside off, lifts it over extra cover off the outside half
back of a length in the corridor, slices under it and is beaten
back of a length in the corridor, gets too far under the pull to place it where he wants. Chips it straight to deep midwicket. Wanted to go wide of long-on
bouncer at leg stump, hurries him on the hook. He can't get bat on it
good length and in at leg stump. Looks to flick and cops it on the thigh guard
offcutter, short and wide outside off. Crunched straight to backward point
god mode D'Arcy. Deep square leg and deep midwicket are about 20 yards apart. He flicks a full ball between them and just clears the boundary
back of a length in the corridor, tapped to extra cover off the back foot
can't clear mid-off and he's missed out on a third consecutive fifty. Offcutter, short and outside off. Looks to flat-bat it over that fielder but he gets it off the high part and chips an easy take
bouncer dug in too short for him to take it on. Ducks under it
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
full ball outside off. Looks to drive on the up through the covers. Gets it off the inside half and it trickles back towards the bowler
back of a length on leg stump, poked to mid-on from the crease
full and late swing away as the batsman lines up to drive through the covers. Beaten
good length outside off, sliced to third man's right
yorker just outside off, jammed past the non-striker with enough craft to steal a single
good length just outside off, shuffles to get in line and clips it aerially to the long leg boundary
looped up outside off, gets down for the reverse sweep but only manages to deflect off his glove
full and just outside off, steps out and flicks to long-on
good length on off stump, nudged to deep midwicket off the back foot
tossed up slow outside off. Bailey brings out a reverse-scythe and bisects backward point and short third man
back of a length on off stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, dabs it into the vacan midwicket region with soft hands and then puts in a big dive to complete the second run
another one falls to mid-off. Botha pedals backwards and is nice and calm as he takes it. Bailey gives the charge to a short ball and cramps himself. Ends up skewing it up with no force
back of a length in the corridor, defended to point off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, poked to point with an open face
short one in the corridor. Shuffles and looks to pull, cops it on the hip
short ball wide outside off, cuts forcefully, and very deliberately over the point fielder
back of a length at off stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
back of a length in the corridor, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot

dropped at deep square leg by Abbott. A very very difficult one. It's a short ball pulled hard and flat, and it dies on him while swerving to his right. He has it covered but it forced to lunge to his right late. Can't pull it off
onto the roof. Overpitched on middle stump, front leg out of the way and the perfect slog if there ever was one. Sails over deep midwicket
short ball outside off, guides it to third man
beats point. Short ball in the corridor, makes room and places the cut perfectly. Third man can't reach it either
full and just inside the tram line, looks to carve it behind point. Beaten
yorker wide outside off, manages to reach and dabs it to third man's right
yorker just outside off. He's hitting the blockhole perfectly. Sliced straight to point
good length wide outside off, looks to swipe across the line, can't get it far. It's a skier in the mid-on region. Maddinson calls for it at midwicket and follows it properly to pouch it
chips and it lands wide of sweeper cover. Short and wide outside off. Stops on him as he shapes for the cut and he stabs it uppishly. Bird picks it up on the bounce
cuts uppishly again, this time behind square. Third man sprints to his right and juggles before sending it back with a flat throw
bouncer on middle stump, pulls it off the high end of the bat to deep square
gets followed down leg side with a yorker, Deflects off the back leg as he looks to flick
slower bouncer just outside off, gives it the charge and slaps it past midwicket after adjusting his bat swing halfway
overpitched on off stump, makes room and slices it over point
slower ball, good length in the corridor. Tapped to long-on
full ball on middle stump, shuffles and half falls over into the off side, exposing all his stumps. But then he brings out the scoop and executes perfectly to get it over the keeper
full and wide outside off, slashes and misses
well placed. Anticipates the angle, steps across to reach it outside off and carves it between point and third man
overpitched outside off, dragged to midwicket with a slog
lovely. They know what the line and length are going to be. Full and wide outside off. He shuffles to an 8th stump line and flicks it past short fine
length and outside off, swings at it but can't connect
walks into the off side and looks to flick another one. Inside edge onto boot but he's not worried how far that's gone. Runs and keeps the strike
slower ball dropped short on middle stump, finds deep square with the pull
yorker on leg stump, squeezed down to long-on
yorker on middle stump, shuffles and flicks straight to deep square
beauty. Good length and just outside off, skips into the leg side and slaps on the up, wayyyyyy over the extra cover boundary
good length outside off, slower ball. Backs away and swipes across the line. Gets a top edge that's easy for backward point
low full toss on middle stump, stays in the crease, gets the front foot away and hammers it straight over the bowler to bisect long-on and long-off
oversteps first ball. Full one outside off, driven straight to extra cover
huuuuuuuuge. What a connection from Roy. Overpitched ball floated up generously on leg stump and he swings sweetly to send it over the midwicket boundary
back of a length on leg stump, clipped to deep square's right off his hip
length on leg stump, flicks on the up to deep square's left
good length angled across off stump, sliced through cover point
good length inswinger, starts at leg stump and goes further down
back of a length and angled across the corridor, wafts at it and is beaten
length on off stump, tapped to cover's right on the up
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
full and loopy outside off, looks to the reverse sweep, cops it on the back leg
hit straight to extra cover. Looks to go hard to a similar ball to the last one. Keeps the reverse sweep away, tries to go over extra cover. Ends up chipping to Bailey
tossed up just outside off, driven to long-on
full at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
good length on off stump, pushed to mid-off on the rise
good length and in at off stump. Waits for it to arrive and taps it into the midwicket area
full and just outside off, driven towards mid-on
back of a length just outside off, pushed to point off the outside half
144kph, short ball climbs in at the batsman from outside off. Gets him on the bicep on his left hand as he looks to evade it
short one in the corridor, drops the bat and lets it go
upper cut lands safely in front of third man. Decides to go after a short ball but is cramped again
full and just outside off, steps out and makes his own room after getting to the pitch. Drives it past extra cover
good length on leg stump, can't get bat on the attempted flick
length ball fired down leg side, keeper can't gather cleanly
length on leg stump, skips down the track and flicks to long-on
short and wide outside off, hangs back, picks the huge gap in the covers with a back foot punch
length on middle stump, backs away and lifts it inside out over the infield on the off side
good length on middle stump, driven to mid-off's right
short and wide outside off, chopped to third man off the thick outside edge
short and wide outside off, backs away and scythes. Misses

short and wide outside off, backs away to try and clear point again. This time he gets bat on it but he's in no control. It's climbing on him, slices it high and backward point runs a few yards backwards and hangs on
short and wide outside off, stays tall in the crease and crashes this on the up through extra cover
back of a length just outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
good length on leg stump, tapped to mid-on on the rise
good length at off stump, backs away and pushes to mid-off's right on the up
back of a length on middle stump, can't get the attempted back foot punch past the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, backs away this time and punches through the covers
good length on leg stump, tapped to midwicket's right but can't beat him for the single at long-on
back of a length just outside off, hurried cut towards backward point

full one on leg stump, very late on the sweep but he gets it to dribble away past short fine off the inside edge. Tymal Mills gives chase and leaves it very late with the slide, but it appears he has managed to pull the ball back in
short and just outside off, cut to point
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-off off the back foot
back of a length on middle stump, deep in the crease to punch it to long-on
short and wide outside off, backs away and looks to cut. Beaten
good length on off stump, looks for the slog sweep, gets a top edge that lobs over the keeper and lands between short third man and short fine leg
back of a length on middle stump, clipped to long-on off the back foot
overpitched just outside off, driven back firmly at the bowler who can't stop it cleanly in his follow through
back of a length on leg stump, clipped to deep square's right with the angle
slower ball on a length, in at middle stump. Dabs it with soft hands through the leg side
slower ball on a length, just outside off. Looks to club it over midwicket who is in the circle. Ends up bunting it aerially in front of long-on
slower ball, back of a length outside off. Slices to short third man
slower ball again, in the corridor. Drags it out to long leg with a swipe
tossed up just outside off, swept off the top edge to deep square
back of a length on middle stump, backs away and punches to long-off
good length, tossed wide outside off. Looks to drive on the up. Gets it down to long-on off the inside half
full on middle stump, steps out and yorks himself. Taps it to extra cover
length on middle stump, exposes the stumps and plays the paddle sweep. Long leg swoops down on it quickly
slider, back of a length outside off. Waits for it to come on and run it through third man. Beaten
slower ball at a length, wide outside off. Tries his luck and swipes at it. Thick outside edge past short third man
slower ball, overpitched outside off. Jams the drive into the pitch and gets it down to long-off
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Steps out and is forced to reach out for the cut. Lifts it straight up to sweeper cover
dug in back of a length, just outside off. Looks to cut for a single to third man, beaten by the rising ball
slower ball, full on off stump. Drives it back to the bowler on the bounce
slower ball, good length on leg stump. Nudges it to deep square on the front foot

length at middle stump, steps out and yorks himself as he looks to drive through the covers. Rolls back down the pitch towards the bowler, who is unable to stop with a lunge to his right despite getting a hand on it
full on middle stump, gets down to paddle and find long leg
full on leg stump. Makes room to drive through the covers, chips it towards midwicket off the inside half of the bat. It falls short of the fielder
length on middle stump, driven to long-on
full on middle stump, steps out and drives on the up to long-on
full on leg stump, drags an attempted heave down to long-on
short ball isn't very far away from him, there's hardly any room. But he gets under this so quickly as he lifts the pull over square leg
almost run out but Bailey can't hit the stumps from midwicket as the batsman miscues this slog
full and wide outside off, meets it at the pitch adn drives to sweeper's right
short ball on middle stump, swats it off the middle to find deep square
yorker outside off, squeezed out to extra cover
good length on middle stump, looks to flick, gets an inside edge onto pad
floated up full and wide outside off, makes room and drives to sweeper
length outside off, gets right behind this with his stride and destroys it with a sweep Out to the deep square boundary
length on off and this time he gets a lot of bat on the reverse sweep. Finds deep point
full on middle stump, chipped to long-on
tossed up outside off, steps out and drags it down to long-on off the inside of the bat
back of a length on leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
slower ball floated wide outside off, dances in the crease to reach it and then thumps it along the floor to beat deep extra cover well to his left
slower ball at a length, wide outside off. Gets close to it again but can't connect on the drive this time
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Shuffles and swings, misses again
slower ball, wide outside off on a length. Reaches out again. Can't connect properly again. This time he ends up pushing it back down the pitch off the inside half
slower ball, short and climbing up above middle stump. Billings also shuffles. Too much. Swats at it and can't connect
what a shot. Slower ball, full outside off. Gets under it and clobbers it over the midwicket boundary with a slog sweep
gets all of this pull shot. It's short and wide outside off. He gets behind it with a shuffle and swings cleanly. Beats deep midwicket to his right
slower length ball, pushed down leg side
short ball in the corridor, late on the pull. Bunts it aerially into the midwicket region
short slower ball outside off, walks into the off side and pull to deep square
short and into the ribs. Goes for the pull, slices it towards long-on
slower short ball at middle stump, checks the pull after being beaten by the variation. Guides it straight to short fine
length ball headed for off stump as he backs away. Looks to dab it to third man, gets an inside edge
oh well played. Hurricanes are panicking now. Low full toss just outside off, walks into the line, gets the legs away from it and ramps it fine
yorker outside off, jams it into the covers off the toe-end
yorker just outside off, tapped well in front of long-on to steal the second
short slower ball at a leg stump line. Shuffles and looks to get his hands through the pull. Can't connect
walks into the off side again as he gets a slower bouncer on middle stump. Swats feebly towards deep square
full on middle stump, extends his arms to drive, but gets it out to long-on off the toe-end
length ball just outside off, swings across the line and can't get bat on it
slower ball on a length, follows the batsman down leg. Deflected to fine leg with a swipe
finds long-on after struggling to make pace on this slog. It's a slower ball on middle stump. He gets the frot foot out of the line and swings for the stands. Doesn't make goof enough connection
short and wide outside off, throws his hands at it after stepping out. Gets an under-edge and manages to squeeze it past short third man
slower ball, full outside off. Steps out and misses
short ball just outside off, hurriedly pulls to long-on
yorker just outside off, gets an inside edge as he looks to hoick this over deep midwicket. Rolls through to the keeper
slower ball on a length, just outside off. Throws him off the shot just enough with that variation. He can only drag this out to long-on off  the inside half
lovely yorker. Tails in and just misses leg stump as the batsman exposes the stumps and looks to carve it. Can't get bat. Billings runs through and beats Wade's throw
slower ball dropped short on leg stump. Billings waits and waits and then heaves to beat deep square to his left
top edge flies fine. Bouncer in at his throat, takes the hook on and has lost that battle. Still gets four

squeezes it past backward point and Sixers are now well and truly in it. It's a great yorker from Archer, right in the slot at middle and off. Somehow, Billings makes room and manages to runs this off the outside part of the bat
beats the outside edge as he bowls a slower ball in the corridor. Receives the throw as they run through and shies at the non-strikers stumps with a wild throw. Misses and gives the extra run
slower ball in the corridor again, slashes and misses
short and wide outside off, looks to cut, gets cramped and can only get it into the off side infield
slower ball, yorker length outside off. He's opted for the switch hit. The left-handed slog can't even clear the right-hander's extra cover
full and wide outside off, heaves, gets an inside edge towards midwicket
slower ball, full toss outside off. Swings across the line, gets it out to deep midwicket off the inside half

length ball wide outside off, looks to punch into the off side, away from the body. Big inside edge down to fine leg. Goes back for the suicidal second run. Fielder shies at the stumps and misses. The bowler, a few yards behind the stumps suddenly realises he could have been a lot closer and finished the game off there
slower bouncer on middle stump, not enough power on the hook as he's made to wait for it. Gets it aerially towards deep square
slower ball, back of a length on middle stump. Makes room and cuts. Inside edge, pitchside, in the leg side
smashes it over the midwicket boundary. Anticipates a bouncer and stays very deep in the crease. Then he drags it from wide outside off and clears the fence
he's done it! He's brought it to the last ball! Completely figured Mills out here. Shuffles across, gets low, picks the slower ball and sweeps it over deep square leg

misses the short ball outside off and he can't believe it. Oh that one was there for the pull. It's what you want when you need six off the last ball. But that skid off the surface that Mills gets, in combination with slightly anxious hands, has saved the Hurricanes.
